meanings.definition: A structure consisting of strips of wood or metal crossed and fastened together with square or diamond-shaped spaces left between, used as a screen or fence or as a support for climbing plants.
meanings.sent1: The lattice on the garden fence allowed the vines to climb and grow.
meanings.sent2: The lattice on the window added a decorative touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the lattice as a ladder to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts formed a lattice of memories, intertwining and connecting in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The lattice cast a beautiful pattern of shadows on the ground in the afternoon sun.

meanings.definition: A regular repeated three-dimensional arrangement of atoms, ions, or molecules in a metal or other crystalline solid.
meanings.sent1: The lattice structure of the crystal determined its properties.
meanings.sent2: The lattice of atoms in the metal gave it strength and stability.
meanings.sent3: The scientist marveled at the intricate lattice of molecules under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The lattice of stars in the night sky seemed to form a cosmic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The lattice arrangement of ions created a stable compound.
